topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/542b637c6368724ef6ca0000#post_542b637c6368724ef6ca0000

What? Why would an axe be better than swords? I mean a sword is a lot more lighter to use, sure you wouldn't want to get hit by an axe, but axes are unwieldy at times. A sword you can use with finesse, its also a bit more flexible when needed.

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/542b637c6368724ef6ca0000#post_542b637c6368724ef6ca0000
Polearms have the advantage of reach. A spearman could stabbity stab you into swiss cheese before you got close enough with your axe to do anything.
topics.author: 5007bbdf7f123b112f00023a

topics.body:
"@Evident Disaster":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/542b642c6368722de56a0000#post_542b642c6368722de56a0000
Axes are sturdier, stronger, and cheaper to make.
They also they the addition of being a very practical tool. Can't cut wood with a sword or spear now can you?
topics.author: 4fde4618945b700aa0002fff

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/542b64756368720390a50000#post_542b64756368720390a50000

You mean because of density and mass? Of course that'd be difficult to cut with a sword, the point of a sword was intended more for fighting flesh and blood, not chopping down trees which are like a meter thick.

Well that and swords vary from type, seriously, some can match an axe in sheer force. But keep this in mind, an axe does blunt more easily, since they're in constant use. Also they can't punch through chainmail armour, leather yes, but not chaimnail, you'd be better off with a polearm.
topics.author: 5046d66d7f123b38980018c6

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/542b64756368720390a50000#post_542b64756368720390a50000

In my opinion, you will receive a dozen of zombie bites in all your body after just hitting one with the axe. Don't forget that axes get stuck in the flesh, and will take you a lot of time and you probably will die before recover the axe due the weight.

topics.body:
"@Shadow_the_Hedgehog":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/542b64446368724fb0ce0000#post_542b64446368724fb0ce0000

Yeah that works too, we could just built a bunch of water based constructs and live on the sea, no Zombie can reach you cause they can't swim or for that matter they can't use boats. The real trouble is sea sickness, unless you happen to be on an anchored kind of structure or have a small island isolated from the rest of the world. 

Now what I'm curious is are we talking Walking Dead Zombies, or more like L4D or wore yet, are we talking Zombie Hunters level of zombies? Zombie Hunters are a really old comic series which had been running over a decade ago, probably not as old as Walking Dead, but still they're older than L4D, its not a very well known web comic on top of that.
topics.author: 5046d66d7f123b38980018c6

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/542b66276368724f054d0100#post_542b66276368724f054d0100

Actually I have, sorry, I'm just trying to say, axes are okay, its just impractical to use since you need to swing it, in some cases this isn't easy, if you're in a room space which severely limits height you'd be better off with something smaller, like a bayonet or knife. 

I'll stick to practicality.

topics.body:
"@Evident Disaster":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/542b642c6368722de56a0000#post_542b642c6368722de56a0000
[bq="Evident Disaster"]"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/542b637c6368724ef6ca0000#post_542b637c6368724ef6ca0000

What? Why would an axe be better than swords? I mean a sword is a lot more lighter to use, sure you wouldn't want to get hit by an axe, but axes are unwieldy at times. A sword you can use with finesse, its also a bit more flexible when needed. [/bq]
Army knives specifically designed for killing people cause those things don't have a sharp edge, rather they're specifically designed for stabbing someone in the brains or such which while it wouldn't have the reach of other weapons is massively important in a zombie apocalypse.

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/542b6c146368722d1ce50100#post_542b6c146368722d1ce50100

True that, the only trouble is, what happens if you're in a hallway cornered by zombies with a wood cutting axe which happens to be around a meter in size? By the way the corridor height level is short, so swinging up and down is next to impossible and risks of hitting the walls on either side is proving to be problematic. Its in these kinds of situations that carrying an axe isn't the best tool for the job. 

Though shotguns are, since its a closed chokepoint, but yeah axes wouldn't be of much use, you'd be better off with a short sword or machete.
